intro: Pentacalia vicelliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments in its native habitat.
